issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: QueryResultCache.LookupInfo ends up keeping a reference to the SemanticAnalyzer from the cached query, for as long as the cached entry is in the cache. We should not be keeping the SemanticAnalyzer around after the query is done executing since they can hold on to quite a bit of memory.
fields.summary: Hive QueryResultCache entries keeping reference to SemanticAnalyzer from cached query

comments.body:
Patch to just fetch the ValidTxnWriteIdList upfront when creating the results cache entry, rather than trying to defer the call to fetch the ValidTxnWriteIdList.
Looked at heap dumps before/after this patch and the results cache entry is no longer hanging onto a reference to the SemanticAnalyzer.

[~jcamachorodriguez] [~gopalv] can you review?
This looked at first like a inner class leaking the parent object - implicit "this" contained in the Supplier inner class?

Yes, the Supplier inner class ended up holding a ref to the SemanticAnalyzer.
Does the fix in the patch make sense, or did you have another fix in mind?
